  1. Oxford 3000
  2. Oxford 12

Words 1101-1200

  1. freedom
    Everyone values their freedom to make choices.

  2. freeze
    Water will freeze if the temperature drops below zero.

  3. frequency
    The frequency of the meetings has increased recently.

  4. frequently
    She frequently visits her grandparents on weekends.

  5. fresh
    The bakery sells fresh bread every morning.

  6. Friday
    We are planning a party on Friday evening.

  7. fridge
    Please put the milk in the fridge to keep it cold.

  8. friend
    My best friend always supports me in difficult times.

  9. friendly
    The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful.

  10. friendship
    Their friendship has lasted for over ten years.

  11. frighten
    The loud noise might frighten the baby.

  12. frightened
    She felt frightened when she heard the strange sound.

  13. frightening
    The movie was so frightening that I couldn’t sleep.

  14. frog
    We saw a green frog near the pond.

  15. from
    He traveled from London to Paris by train.

  16. front
    There is a beautiful garden in front of the house.

  17. frozen
    The lake was completely frozen during winter.

  18. fruit
    Eating fresh fruit is good for your health.

  19. fry
    She decided to fry some eggs for breakfast.

  20. fuel
    The car ran out of fuel on the highway.

  21. full
    The glass was full of water.

  22. fully
    She fully understands the importance of the project.

  23. fun
    We had so much fun at the amusement park.

  24. function
    The main function of this tool is to cut wood.

  25. fund
    The school received a fund to build a new library.

  26. fundamental
    Reading is a fundamental skill for learning.

  27. funding
    The project was delayed due to a lack of funding.

  28. funny
    The comedian told a very funny joke.

  29. fur
    The cat’s fur is soft and shiny.

  30. furniture
    They bought new furniture for their living room.

  31. further
    We need to walk further to reach the park.

  32. furthermore
    The book is interesting; furthermore, it is educational.

  33. future
    She is excited about her future plans.

  34. gain
    He worked hard to gain the trust of his team.

  35. gallery
    The art gallery displayed beautiful paintings.

  36. game
    They played a fun game of chess after dinner.

  37. gang
    The gang of kids played football in the street.

  38. gap
    There is a small gap between the door and the floor.

  39. garage
    The car is parked in the garage.

  40. garden
    She grows flowers and vegetables in her garden.

  41. gas
    The stove runs on natural gas.

  42. gate
    Please close the gate when you leave.

  43. gather
    They gather every weekend to play music together.

  44. general
    The general idea of the plan is to improve efficiency.

  45. generally
    People generally prefer sunny weather.

  46. generate
    The wind turbines generate electricity for the town.

  47. generation
    This generation is more familiar with technology.

  48. generous
    She is very generous with her time and money.

  49. genre
    My favorite genre of music is classical.

  50. gentle
    He gave the baby a gentle pat on the back.

  51. gentleman
    The gentleman opened the door for the lady.

  52. geography
    She is studying geography to learn about different countries.

  53. get
    Can you get me a glass of water, please?

  54. ghost
    The old house is said to be haunted by a ghost.

  55. giant
    The giant tree in the park is over 100 years old.

  56. gift
    She received a beautiful gift for her birthday.

  57. girl
    The little girl was playing with her doll.

  58. girlfriend
    He introduced his girlfriend to his family.

  59. give
    Please give me a moment to finish this task.

  60. glad
    I am glad to hear that you passed the exam.

  61. glass
    He drank a glass of orange juice.

  62. global
    Climate change is a global issue that affects everyone.

  63. glove
    She wore a pair of gloves to keep her hands warm.

  64. go
    They decided to go to the beach for the weekend.

  65. goal
    His goal is to become a successful writer.

  66. god
    Many people pray to God for guidance.

  67. gold
    The ring is made of pure gold.

  68. golf
    He enjoys playing golf on weekends.

  69. good
    She is a good student who always works hard.

  70. goodbye
    They said goodbye before leaving for the airport.

  71. goods
    The store sells a variety of goods, including clothes and shoes.

  72. govern
    The mayor will govern the city for the next four years.

  73. government
    The government announced new policies to improve education.

  74. grab
    He tried to grab the book before it fell off the table.

  75. grade
    She received a high grade on her math test.

  76. gradually
    The weather is gradually getting warmer.

  77. graduate
    She will graduate from university next year.

  78. grain
    The farmer harvested a large amount of grain this season.

  79. grand
    The hotel has a grand view of the mountains.

  80. grandfather
    My grandfather loves to tell stories about his childhood.

  81. grandmother
    Her grandmother taught her how to bake cookies.

  82. grandparent
    Spending time with my grandparent is always enjoyable.

  83. grant
    The university will grant scholarships to deserving students.

  84. grass
    The children played on the green grass in the park.

  85. grateful
    I am grateful for all the help you have given me.

  86. great
    She did a great job on the project.

  87. green
    The hills are covered with green grass.

  88. greet
    He went to greet the guests at the door.

  89. grey
    The sky turned grey before it started to rain.

  90. ground
    The ground was wet after the heavy rain.

  91. group
    A group of students worked together on the project.

  92. grow
    Plants need sunlight and water to grow.

  93. growth
    The company has seen significant growth in the past year.

  94. guarantee
    The product comes with a one-year guarantee.

  95. guard
    The guard stood at the entrance of the building.

  96. guess
    Can you guess the answer to this question?

  97. guest
    The guest arrived early for the dinner party.

  98. guide
    The tour guide showed us around the museum.

  99. guilty
    He felt guilty for forgetting her birthday.

  100. guitar
    She played a beautiful song on her guitar.
